title: Maldivian to fly to Sri Lanka’s Ratmalana airport
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT –  Island Aviation Services Limited of Maldives will fly to Sri Lanka’s Ratmalana Airport twice a week in the first international scheduled flights in 50 years, the state airport agency said.
Maldivian will operate 50 seater DHC Dash-8 aircraft three times a week.
Airport Aviation Services Ltd, the state airport agency said international flights were starting after 50 years.
Sri Lanka’s main international airport is in Katunayake, north of Colombo.
